warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching your back (cat) and dropping your belly (cow). Perform 2 sets of 10 reps.
Swing arms back and forth, opening the chest. Perform 2 sets of 15 reps.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Twist your torso side to side, keeping your hips stable. Perform 2 sets of 20 reps.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
exercises.execution: 1. Grip the bar with a wide grip. 2. Pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight. 3. Slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at the lat pull-down machine with a neutral grip attachment.
exercises.alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the attachment with palms facing each other. 2. Pull down to your chest, keeping elbows close to your body. 3. Return slowly to the start.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form, similar to the main exercise.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement for maximum back engagement.

exercises.setup: Use a preacher bench to angle your upper arm.
exercises.execution: 1. Sit at the preacher bench with your upper arms resting on the pad. 2. Curl the weight up, focusing on the biceps. 3. Lower the weight slowly, maintaining tension.
exercises.weight: Use a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with controlled form, focusing on the stretch at the bottom.
exercises.rest_time: 60 seconds after completing both exercises in the superset
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Set up the cable at hand height, face away, and take one or two steps forward.
exercises.alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Stand facing away from the cable machine. 2. Curl with both arms simultaneously, focusing on the biceps peak.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with a focus on maintaining tension throughout the movement.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your elbows locked in place to prevent cheating and maximize biceps engagement.

exercises.setup: Use a chest-supported row machine or incline bench.
exercises.execution: 1. Lie face down on the bench with your chest supported. 2. Pull the weight towards your chest, squeezing your back muscles. 3. Return to the starting position with control.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with good form, focusing on squeezing the back muscles.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at a cable row machine with feet braced against the platform.
exercises.alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the handle with both hands. 2. Pull towards your abdomen, keeping your back straight. 3. Return slowly to the start.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with a focus on maintaining tension throughout the movement.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your chest pressed against the pad to isolate the back muscles effectively.

exercises.setup: Set up the cable at hand height, face away, and take one or two steps forward.
exercises.execution: 1. Stand facing away from the cable machine. 2. Curl with both arms simultaneously, focusing on the biceps peak. 3. Lower the weight slowly, maintaining tension.
exercises.weight: Use a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with controlled form, focusing on the stretch and tension.
exercises.rest_time: 60 seconds after completing both exercises in the superset
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit on an incline bench with dumbbells in each hand.
exercises.alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Sit back on the incline bench. 2. Curl the weights up, focusing on the biceps. 3. Lower the weights slowly, maintaining tension.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with a focus on maintaining tension throughout the movement.
exercises.additional_tips: Ensure a full range of motion to maximize biceps engagement and growth.
